sentences.en: After the cast has been applied, elevate the extremity to reduce local edema.
sentences.cn: 在上石膏后, 应抬高肢体以减少局部水肿.

sentences.en: Consciously be sensitive to others and to elevate their level of consciousness.
sentences.cn: 有意识地对其他人敏感并尝试着提升他们的意识水平.

sentences.en: Don't elevate your superiors to superstar status.
sentences.cn: 别把你的上司捧得跟超级巨星似的。

sentences.en: Emotional stress can elevate blood pressure.
sentences.cn: 情绪压力可能会导致血压升高。

sentences.en: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.cn: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

sentences.en: Gradually elevate the patient into anupright position.
sentences.cn: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

sentences.en: He used a couple of bolsters to elevate his head.
He was elevated to the post of president.
sentences.cn: 他被提拔到总裁的职位。

sentences.en: His energy and talent elevate him to godlike status.
sentences.cn: 他因精力充沛、才华横溢而被尊为神人。

sentences.en: Hold the child if possible ; otherwise, elevate his head and chest slightly.
sentences.cn: 尽可能将婴儿抱起, 或将他的头和胸部轻轻抬起.

sentences.en: It is necessary to elevate the living standards.
Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.cn: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.en: Reading good books elevate one's mind.
sentences.cn: 阅读好书可提高人的心灵修养.

sentences.en: Results Elevate vigilance, early diagnosis, prompt treatment can get good result.
sentences.cn: 结果提高警惕 、 早期诊断, 及时治疗能取得满意效果.

sentences.en: The nurse's fingers elevate the infant's jaw to extend his neck.
sentences.cn: 护士的手指应抬起婴儿的下颏使他的颈部后伸.

sentences.en: To elevate the chair, you just push down, like this.
sentences.cn: 要把椅子抬高, 你就往下按一下, 像这样.

sentences.en: We do not elevate it to the dignity of a first principle.
sentences.cn: 我们不会将它提升到首要原则的高度.

sentences.en: We should elevate the quality in order to enlarge the sales amount.
sentences.cn: 为了增加销售量,我们应当提高产品质量.

sentences.en: What resources can a club create to elevate its public image?
sentences.cn: 扶轮社可以开创什麽样的资源来提高它的公众形象?

words.tran_cn: 提高的；高尚的；严肃的；欢欣的
高地；海拔；提高；崇高；正面图
电梯；升降机；升降舵；起卸机
提高；抬起；振奋；提拔（elevate的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

trans.tran_cn: 提升…的职位， 提高， 改善； 使情绪高昂； 举起， 使上升
trans.tran_en: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before
